body_html:
Even if the default timeout can be set infinite, I think it's good to provide an option, a user may set a reasonable timeout for their task if they wish to face an exception rather than an infinite hang (due to problems in workers).

In my case I got hit by #1838. Basically, the root cause opencv/opencv#5150 prevents reliable use of "fork" multiprocessing method along with pthreads-using calls inside workers, and OpenCV is affected.

I'll submit a patch to fix DataLoader and torch.multiprocessing docs to mention this issue (and also warning that if unpickling fails, it would hang too)?

body:
Even if the default timeout can be set infinite, I think it's good to provide an option, a user may set a reasonable timeout for their task if they wish to face an exception rather than an infinite hang (due to problems in workers).

In my case I got hit by https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/1838. Basically, the root cause https://github.com/opencv/opencv/issues/5150 prevents reliable use of "fork" multiprocessing method along with pthreads-using calls inside workers, and OpenCV is affected.

I'll submit a patch to fix DataLoader and torch.multiprocessing docs to mention this issue (and also warning that if unpickling fails, it would hang too)?
